titleStmt.title: T. J. Cornelison et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9909

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned would most respectfully ask your Exelecny B. Magoffin Governor of Kentucky to pardon J. R Isaacs now confined in the state penetentiary convicted in the Jackson Circuit Court upon a charge of manslaughter 15th Novr/60.

T. J. Cornelison
william willies
hutchison powel
Geo. Caudel
John Coyle
Levi Park
H. O Wild
E. H. Harrison J P J C
John Reece
John Dishman
A, Powell
Thos Richardson
S W abrams
Philip Marcum
Alfred Evans
J. L. Tussey
Wm Metcalf
Bartley Rogers
Hugh O Donnell
Cornelious Moor
Franklin Faubus
Bodie Baker
William Blanton
James Cox
Wm Abner
Henrey Angle
Samuel Abner
William Shelton
Thos I Eyle
Morrel tax
Andrew Cornelius
Robrt Hayes
Henry Merius
M N Forbus J P J C
Matthias Seabon
Wm Harris
Wm Willson
R. E. Nichols
James Tincker one of Jury
Jacob Hellard
Joel Parratt
Allen Sumers
M, C, Hughs
Wm C Todd
Saml Correl
E Forbus
Potition for J R Isaacks
John,, S,, Hamilton
James Engle
Mical Mccinny
G M Pigg
pilip Gabberd
Jno Marcum
W. H Randall
J Newcum
Thomas H Carson
J, K, Scot
M Freeman J P J C

Wm Clark jr

B H Robberson

robert ramsey

Wm Allum baugh
H J Hughs --
Josip a s Bell

David Goury

Isaacs -- case
2 yrs Peny --
Jackson Cir Ct
Issue pardon
B, M.
Manslaughter
Issd Jany 29. 1861
